stories.title: Dart: The Features I Wish It Had
How a Star New York Times Reporter Got Paid by Government Agencies He Covered

stories.text:
With the cloud storage companies increasingly snooping on the content on the storage I have been looking at a module for nginx or something similar to do on the fly encryption/decryption

The idea is simple - transform the data on the fly so the storage backend has no ability to extract the unencrypted data.

Has anyone seen anything that solves this problem?
stories.title: Ask HN: Nginx/proxy encryption filter module like rclone's?
WhatsApp and other social media platforms restricted in Zambia amidst elections

stories.text:
I’ve come across CRDTs and I’m excited for their potential but I’m concerned that it doesn't really play nicely with databases that I know of. Regardless of whether I use CRDTs during transport, whenever I update my database state, I will still have to do some kind of locking beit pessimistic or optimistic before writing data.

Unless there is a DB which accepts CRDTs, OTs or some kind of patchsets as part of its DSL and it handles the concurrency internally? Are there any such databases?

Effectively a very sophisticated version of the `UPDATE` command.
stories.title: Ask HN: Are there any databases backed by CRDTs?
